properties.name: Smackover Formation
properties.description: High-concentration lithium in salty brines; one of the richest deposits in North America. Basin extends from East Texas into Louisiana and Arkansas.
properties.counties: Harrison, Panola, Rusk, Gregg, Marion, Cass, Upshur, Smith, Cherokee
properties.development: Active development by Exxon, Chevron, Halliburton, Smackover Lithium, TerraVolta (DOE $225M funding), EnergyX (50,000 tons/year by 2030). Direct lithium extraction from brines; pilot facilities operational in Texarkana region.
properties.reserves_estimate: One of largest lithium resources in North America

properties.name: Round Top Mountain
properties.minerals: Heavy REEs (Dy, Tb, Y), Lithium, Beryllium, Uranium, Thorium
properties.description: Large rare earth element deposit in a Paleogene laccolith containing over 300,000 metric tons of rare earth oxides. Includes heavy REEs critical for magnets, electronics, and defense applications.
properties.development: Active development by Texas Mineral Resources Corp. (TMRC) and USA Rare Earth LLC. Plans for onsite processing using acid leaching and electromagnetic methods. Defense Department contract awarded. Mining targeted to start in 2020s with production of high-purity dysprosium and up to 2,000 tons of magnets annually.
properties.reserves_estimate: 300,000+ MT rare earth oxides with high heavy REE concentration

properties.name: Llano Uplift (Central Mineral Region)
properties.minerals: REEs, Uranium, Thorium, Beryllium, Lithium, Industrial Minerals
properties.description: Historic mining region in Texas Hill Country exposing Precambrian basement rocks. Contains pegmatite deposits with rare earths, uranium, thorium, and critical minerals. Currently in research and assessment phase with significant academic interest from UT Austin Bureau of Economic Geology.
properties.counties: Llano, Burnet, San Saba, Mason, Gillespie, Blanco
properties.development: Research stage. Historic mining for iron, granite, and uranium in mid-20th century. Recent USGS assessments show potential for REE extraction from pegmatites. No active commercial production; ongoing geological surveys.

properties.name: Sierra Blanca / Eagle Mountains District
properties.description: Beryllium deposits in volcanic rocks and pegmatites in Trans-Pecos region. Associated with Round Top Mountain REE deposit. Resources identified but largely undeveloped. Historic fluorite mining in area.
properties.development: No current commercial production. Resources identified through USGS surveys and academic research. Beryllium potential noted in association with Round Top development. Exploratory sampling ongoing.

properties.name: Brewster County Ranch
properties.description: 353,785-acre ranch (1,432 kmÂ²) with REE mineralization discovered via geological survey on state-owned land purchased by Texas General Land Office in 2024. Specific elements and quantities not publicly detailed. Potential for future exploration and mining, but no active development reported.
properties.development: Exploratory stage. Land acquired by Texas GLO in 2024. No drilling permits or development plans announced. Geological assessment likely ongoing. Represents strategic state investment in critical minerals.

properties.name: Dell City Area
properties.description: Exploratory sampling of igneous rocks in Hudspeth County. USGS surveys indicate underground REE potential similar to Round Top Mountain. Ongoing mapping and assessment funded by USGS Earth MRI program ($3.4 million allocated in 2024).
properties.development: Research and assessment phase. USGS Earth Mapping Resources Initiative (Earth MRI) active surveys. No drilling or extraction permits. Academic collaboration with UT Austin and USGS. Focus area for federal critical minerals mapping.

properties.name: Panhandle Helium District
properties.description: One of the largest helium-producing regions in the United States. Crude helium extracted from natural gas; critical for semiconductor manufacturing, medical imaging (MRI), aerospace, and scientific research. Texas ranks among top U.S. producers.
properties.counties: Potter, Moore, Hutchinson, Carson, Gray, Hansford, Ochiltree, Lipscomb, Hemphill
properties.development: Active production. Five major extraction plants operational with new facilities started in 2024. Commercial operators include Air Products, Linde, and independent producers. Strategic resource for U.S. technology and defense sectors. Federal helium reserve nearby in Amarillo.
properties.reserves_estimate: Multiple decades of production at current rates

properties.name: Cave Peak / Trans-Pecos Volcanic Field
properties.description: Porphyry-style molybdenum deposit with associated rare earth elements in Trans-Pecos volcanic region. Research stage; no commercial production. Part of larger Tertiary volcanic complex with multiple mineralization styles.
properties.development: Research stage only. Academic studies by UT Austin and USGS. No mining permits or commercial interest. Geological significance as indicator of regional mineralization potential.
